title: Scarred by War, Ukraine’s Children Face Years of Trauma
description: For countless Ukrainian children, the war has brought long-term physical and psychological injuries. Those who have suffered serious physical harm or the loss of a parent now face a challenging path forward.
dc:creator: Megan Specia and Brendan Hoffman
media:credit: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times
media:description: Maryna Ponomariova, 6, whose left leg had to be amputated below the knee after a devastating attack on her home in Kherson, is now learning to walk again with the help of Nazar Borozniuk at Ohmadyt Children’s Hospital in Kviv, Ukraine, earlier this month.
